website_summaries.verdict: A compact smart charger that works with lead-acid, AGM, and lithium-ion batteries and sells for a reasonable price.
pros: Able to resurrect batteries that have drained as low as 1 volt
Built-in thermal sensor is designed to prevent overcharging in hot climates and undercharging in cold climates
Automatic charging feature allows you to keep a battery connected indefinitely without fear of overcharging
cons: This 1-amp unit may take up to two days to charge a 12-volt battery

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to work at all
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem to charge my battery at all. It just flashes red, meaning that the battery is less than 75 percent charged. After keeping it hooked up for a long period of time with the same result, I eventually fully charged the battery with a different charger and then attached this one. It still flashed red for about an hour before I finally just disconnected it.
customer_reviews.author: Skeptic

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Sleek
customer_reviews.text: Recently I purchased a travel trailer. To charge and maintain the battery, I decided on this new NOCO charger. So far, I’m impressed with the quality of the item at what is a bargain compared to other similar chargers. As you can see from the picture, I used it on my deep cycle battery, and everything worked as described. I’ll give a long term impression after using this for a few seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Knowledgeable Buyer

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE THIS PRODUCT!!  - NOTHING BUT A BIG SCAM
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE THIS PRODUCT!! - THERE IS NO step-by step user manual (at least I never received one. ) Thus, it is impossible to know how to operate this, and the user is left to just 'try your best" without any guide or information. All there is is just LOTS OF CLAIMS AND PROMISES, but NO ACTUAL INFORMATION. and NO instructions or user guide (at least NOTHING WAS EVER SENT TO ME when I bought the product.) Maybe it does work , but it is impossible to tell, because there is NO STEP-BY-STEP USER GUIDE . THIS PRODUCT APPEARS TO BE A BIG SCAM. ---
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Worse than useless
customer_reviews.text: Got this to keep the battery maintained on a car I rarely need to drive right now. Started out ok, then malfunctioned and drained my battery from 12.4 to 8.5 volts in 10 days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING!!!!
customer_reviews.text: this battery maintainer/charger is suppose to be able to recognize when a battery is fully charged and maintain the battery. I dont know if i got a defective noco genius 1 but mine DID NOT recognize when battery is fully charged and kept charging. I heard boiling water noises within my 12V sealed battery and unplugged it. I tested the battery a day afterwards and it was fully charged while noco had it on red light (below 75%). DO NOT BUY BEFORE YOU DAMAGE YOUR BATTERY OR BURST THE BATTERY. I suggest amazon remove its best seller and amazons choice labels until further investigation of this product to deem its safety.
customer_reviews.author: David Y

customer_reviews.title: Best battery maintainer
customer_reviews.text: Definitely better then the old out of date battery tender brand. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Ama

customer_reviews.title: Simply easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I have a car that doesn't get drive often. Hopefully this help maintain the battery, and is ready for the times I decide the drive the car.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shao

customer_reviews.title: Blinks, doesn’t charge
customer_reviews.text: This doesn’t work. Tried it on 3 different batteries, 2 that were definitely good, 1 that may have been too dead. Left on for over 24 hours each time... nothing. Save your money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False Claim On Charging Power
customer_reviews.text: Claims to be able to charge simple lawn mower battery. Left charging for 3 days and finally showed “charged”. Turned the key and there wasn’t even enough power to turn over engine. Just a click. Will return this product.
customer_reviews.author: PGH

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought a noco genius 1 charger 3 weeks ago. I bought 2 new agm batteries that are fully charged and when i installed them in my moped it turns on my moped. The charger is on standby when i put the charger on both the batteries even if my moped is on the charger doesn't charge it. I put the noco charger on a new car battery and its still on standby. What is going on?
customer_reviews.author: juwan charlot

customer_reviews.title: Died on first use
customer_reviews.text: Junk. It died while trying to charge my RV battery. I can do nothing with it. I can not select a battery type; it goes back to Standby. It even sends 15 volt pulses when it is in Standby/Off and not connected to a battery. If it worked, I think it would be a good charger.
customer_reviews.author: Sodman

customer_reviews.title: Check the Fuse
customer_reviews.text: I just got this and It wasnt even registering on my scooter battery. I pulled the fuse and noticed it had blown. Anyhow, I ordered a pack of fuses on amazon, and hopefully, it will work. FYI, its a mini 2 amp fuse.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Kang

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12v AGM battery on my Hyundai Elantra 2017 which is dead thanks to CovID-19! The battery was almost 2 days under the charging with this device (unmounted from the car), yet the LED indicator was blinking red! So I gave up and put the battery back! Nothing! It was same as before unable to start my car. I wish there was some indicator of any progress on the charger. I got board after 2 days of seeing that nothing has changed!
customer_reviews.author: damon

customer_reviews.title: did not work for my v8 chevy tahoe
customer_reviews.text: i let my battery charge for 3 days and the battery was not charged nor did it work. returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: NOT for automobiles !
customer_reviews.text: Just FYI - this charger only works for batteries UP TO 30 AMPS ! Most car batteries are 600-800 cold cranking amps. Left it on my car for 2 weeks and still failed to start. Ended up buying another charger that was 1000amps and car started after having it on less than 12 hours. There is a note, at the bottom of the product description that mentions in passing that this charger is only good for batteries up to 30 AMPS.. that should be in BOLD at the TOP OF THE DESCRIPTION.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: What a great auto battery charger
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I had a charger and it was big and heavy and complicated. This one is the exact opposite, small and light, and it works perfectly. I got it out of the box, assembled the cables which took maybe five seconds, read the manual, another four minutes and followed the directions to set it at 12 volts. The red light started flashing indicating it was charging and two hours later my battery was at 100% and the charger had the green light on. This is a no brainer, all you really have to know is the voltage on your battery and why type it is. I highly recommend this product, and the price is just great too.
customer_reviews.author: JJP Sarasota

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for car batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to charge my 50 amp car battery for 72 hours and still flashing red. I figured I needed a new battery. I went to auto zone and had them test it just in case. They tested and charged it for free. So really it was a waste of money for me. Maybe others had better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work in any obvious way
customer_reviews.text: I just returned mine back. I tried it over 2 weeks to trickle charge my car battery. Let it run as long as the specified 60 hours. But sometimes the light just remains red, slowly blinking on and off. Sometimes it turns green but turns red again a while later and never turns green again. Didn't really charge my battery or "fix it" with the "desulfation". I am disappointed because this is a very compact, beautiful looking device. Now I bought a Schumacher 8 Amp one instead. Let's see if that works any better. I also bought a DeWalt 1400 peak amp jump starter and it already saved my life this morning, when I went grocery shopping.
customer_reviews.author: TrollHntr

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised by how tiny this is compared to my dad's old charger. I bought this to charge the marine battery that powers my backup sump pump. Worked great. Took well over 24 hours to charge but I suspect it was almost completely dead. Now I can just charge the battery periodically so its always ready if the main pump fail or power goes out in a storm. Much easier and safer then lugging a heavy battery up the basement, steps, to the car, and into the auto parts store to have it charged, out to the car, down the basement steps, and finally put it back in the sump pump all without dropping it or hurting my back.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Takes good care of your expensive batteries when not in use.
customer_reviews.text: Simple and smart device. Seems well engineered and manufactured. Solid clamps and attachment hardware. Simple to operate. Just connect it ! Bought two of these. Use one to keep the starter battery on my fuel injected generator healthy and ready for action. Use the other to keep the AGM battery for our elecric trolling motor healthy when not out fishing. These are small enough to fit inside of a TayMac MM420C outdoor outlet enclosure. I used this for the generator. Had to enlarge the hole at the bottom of the enclosure with a dremel tool and sanding drum. With the clear cover I cans see the charger status light.
customer_reviews.author: RSBolt

customer_reviews.title: Nice battery charger that’s super easy to operate.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I’ve ever used a battery charger and it was not difficult. I charged two cars batteries that do not get driven much and the charger did what it suppose to do. The only thing that I didn’t like is it took so long to charge. In retrospect I heard it’s better to slow charge a battery then a fast charge.
customer_reviews.author: Mas Toyoda

customer_reviews.title: Wouldnt Recommend for marine battery
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews and ads, it seems like its a great product. I purchased this Genius 1 frankly because it was a great deal. However, the unit seems to be struggling to try and charge/ revive my 5-year-old marine battery. It's been charging for 3 days now still flashing red. I don't have a voltmeter to check the actual status/ volts. I would recommend to use this as a float charger only! If you need to charge big car batteries I suggest getting something with more amps such as genius5 or 10. It works well with the little 7amp hour UPS batteries though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Rosado

customer_reviews.title: Did not work as described
customer_reviews.text: I hadn't driven my car for a month. I tried starting it and it didn't work. I ordered the trickle charger based on the reviews and new that it would take a couple of days to charge. 7 days on the trickle charger and the battery hadn't charged. I took the battery to Auto Zone, they tested it, and tried charging it but they said it was "dead." The "dead battery" indicator on the charger never turned on.
customer_reviews.author: Gnlucila

customer_reviews.title: My mower battery is like new again
customer_reviews.text: I had been struggling with an older battery charger for several months to get my riding mower to start each time. It would barely crank after days of charging and sometimes I would have to let it charge again for a day because the battery would die again before the mower started. I decided to try a NOCO Genius 1 instead of getting a new battery. It took several days to go through all the cycles the first time, but my mower now cranks like it has a new battery and starts in one second. Wow ! I'm very impressed !
customer_reviews.author: K. Keller

customer_reviews.title: another replacement Does not work
customer_reviews.text: While these looked good the bottom line is they don't work. It has been on a full battery just to keep it fully charges and the display is slow flashing pink. DVM indicated a fully charged battery and another brand charges shows fully charged. I bought this as a maintainer but it just doesn't work. Has been on the battery for over 24 hours with the same slow flashing pink light. Save the bother and buy another brand. I will be returning this to amazon for a refund this time
customer_reviews.author: John Henry

customer_reviews.title: very useful and effective!
customer_reviews.text: Quite the intelligent charger! I've used it already on 6 volt, 12 volt and lithium batteries. Had to read instructions carefully but soon got the hang of its controls. I really like the wide range of things it will charge but not overcharge. So many battery-operated devices come with a "charger" but they truly aren't; they are constant voltage power supplies and will ruin your battery quickly by overcharging. Ergo, I bought this as an investment in my investments. I made up an adapter so I can charge devices which have the common jack. Such would be a bonus if it were already in the box. Wink wink to the supplier!
customer_reviews.author: RetireDon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, battery saving!
customer_reviews.text: Because of 2 moves my beloved pink Buddy 125 was dormant for 8 months, and the battery died. Fed up with the local scooter guys saying she'd need a new battery and a new this and that on top of the drain and clean I already knew she'd need, I figured it would be worth a try to get a little home battery charger -- I'M SO HAPPY I DID! It's very easy to use, well-made, and my scooter started right up after I patiently waited for a full charge. (I turned her off immediately, of course!) I love this doodad!
customer_reviews.author: Lashel

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It won't bring the battery to full charge after more than a week connected. it is still flashing red. Not sure if a higher amp version would have worked. Not happy about it.
customer_reviews.author: ARC

customer_reviews.title: Save your battery
customer_reviews.text: If like me, your car is doing more sitting than driving, you may find your car won't start when needed. Just hook up this charger and the problem is solved; it will keep your battery charged and ready to go. I recently bought a new battery and found it was charged less than 75% when I arrived home, 12 hours on this charger and it is now at 100%. An inexpensive device that will save you lots of aggravation and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Eunos09

customer_reviews.title: Great reliable charger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to charge my Li-Iron battery pack for my kayak trolling motor, which it has the option for this type of battery. Also really like the option of repairing battery. I was able to recovery some notebook battery by using this function (I have brand new batteries purchase years ago, never use it, because the batter level drop down below 1 Volt, the BMS won't allow notebook to charge it.) I was able to use the function to restore it around 1 Volt, then use the notebook to charge it. Besides, I loved the 1 amp charger for battery, which means it offer better protection to charge your battery.
customer_reviews.author: Wei-I

customer_reviews.title: restored marine sump pump battery
customer_reviews.text: Worked to stop the annoying alarm which was telling me to replace my sump battery. I had bought the battery about a year prior and it just sits in the basement doing very little as we've never lost power. Contemplated not bothering with a back up battery sump pump but at the price of this charger I figured why not. The restore took over 3 days but now battery is back working and no annoying alarms
customer_reviews.author: davo

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: My generator, which hadn't been used much has an auto start/pull start dual option and went to run it, just for the sake of running it...get some oil kicking around and get the fuel stabilizer going through it. The battery was stone cold dead, and opted to pull start, but it was one of the selling point options that I prefer, in case girlfriend has to start it, as well as just ease of use. Enter the search for a trickle charger and this one came up as a reasonably priced, easy to use 12v option. And very happy with the purchase...within 6-8 hours had the battery in like new condition. Happy with the purchase and recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: S&J

customer_reviews.title: Does Most Of What The Manufacturer Claims
customer_reviews.text: This Is a nifty little charger I bought to maintain my motorcycle battery and charge new ones. It does those two things just fine but, out of curiosity, I connected it to a known dead battery that would only take about a quarter charge. Instead of recognizing it was a bad battery, it charged it as if it were new and when the battery began to sulfate, dripping acid out of the vent, it did not correct that either. So it did not live up to two of the claims that NOCO represents this charger with. I'm going to keep it anyway. I also think these are overpriced for what they are. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: killface

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: My entire life I have had many cars, lawn tractors, RV's all with dead batteries all the time .I could not run everything enough to keep it charged up. I purchased large wheeled commercial chargers that would boil the batteries. They were large enough to start the car with a dead battery a bad idea. This is why the alternator might maintain current but never fully charges the battery. This is ideal by very slowing bringing the battery to full charge. Higher amps of charge can cause pieces of Lead to fall off during charging falling to the bottom of the plates shorting them out.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: 7 days and still flashing red or orange!
customer_reviews.text: I had it charging a Ford ranger battery for 7 days and it never fully charged... I thought the battery might be dead so I tried it on my Ford Fusion same thing 7 days later still flashing orange slowly the company never emailed me back to see if this was normal... I’m returning this one and trying noco genius 10amp.... if that doesn’t work I’m going with a different company
customer_reviews.author: KARLA

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION!
customer_reviews.text: It took a good while (over a day...) to bring back my depleted battery. But when I finally saw the GREEN light and tried to crank the engine it turned over as you'd expect an engine with a decent battery should. I probably still need to consider leaving the charger attached for battery "conditioning" when the car isn't getting enough use, but that will come eventually. For now I'm relieved to discover the car's battery is OK enough to accept a decent charge from a decent device. Note also: NOCO customer support was there if it was necessary, but once I saw that GREEN light the dawgs could be called off, and were. Great purchase and I recommend it unconditionally!
customer_reviews.author: M. RUSSO

customer_reviews.title: Slower than I expected and Difficult to see in bright light
customer_reviews.text: 2 complaints for what is otherwise an affordable, convenient, quality product. 1. It charges much more slowly than I expected. I knew I was buying the slower version but, man, it's really slow. 2. The light indicators are very hard to see in bright light. At first I couldn't even tell the lights were on to show me it was charging.
customer_reviews.author: SHEFF

customer_reviews.title: Charges a deeply discharged optima redtop
customer_reviews.text: Used this to bring back my optima redtop. I was having an issue with my 3 year old redtop not keeping a charge (kept dropping below 9.5v and would not keep over 11v when off).....i have not run the jeep since i charged the battery since im actively working on it. So im not sure if the battery is healed or not. If not atleast i know this will charge it if it drops under 10v
customer_reviews.author: Shaun K.

customer_reviews.title: Good trickle charge
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up to my dead car battery. Charged it in about 2 days. Only use car about once per month and got tired of dead battery each time so this looks like it will do the trick if I leave hooked up all the time. Since the ext. cord goes under hood to unit I can't shut hood. A better setup would be to buy the permanent ring battery leads, mount unit by grill so ext cord could be plugged in so you just have to plug and unplug the ext. cord and keep the hood shut all the time without removing unit each time, but for now can live with this setup.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Does the job & easy to store.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great decision. My battery in my John Deer was on its last leg. I bought this charger in hope's that my battery could be saved. And this little charger charged up this battery in 12 hrs. I am definitely grateful for this little charger. Fits perfectly in my tool box. It's not a big bully charger. Thank heavens for that. I think it works great. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M Collins

customer_reviews.title: Fully-Automatic Smart Charger
customer_reviews.text: I took my SUV in for routine maintenance and was told that my battery charge was in the yellow. The mechanic recommended a new battery. I talked to the service rep and he said with people driving less they are finding more batteries in the yellow and recommended driving my SUV more. I picked up my SUV, got on to Amazon and found this charger. I received the charger the next day, hooked it up to my battery, and with the slow-charge, it was back to full charge within 8 hours. It saved me time and money. Thanks NOCO and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: LED never changes color.
customer_reviews.text: This was light weight and easy to use, but after thoroughly charging a battery, the red LED never stooped pulsing. After reaching 75% charge, the charger LED is supposed to switch to a solid green LED to indicate complete charge. I tested my battery with a Voltmeter to confirm charge was near or above 12V indicating the charger did work, but the < 75% red pulsing light was still on and never changed.
customer_reviews.author: GPH

customer_reviews.title: Worked great, fixed a battery that wouldn't fully charge.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brand new Subaru Outback. I had battery issues from the start, with the battery draining enough to need a jump off I didn't drive it for two weeks. Subaru replaced the battery but it never showed a voltage above 12.4 and drained to 12.2 or less in just a few days. After one overnight use of this charger, the battery registered 12.6 volts. After a week of no use, it had drained to 12.4. After a 20 Mike drive the battery displayed 12.6 volts. That result has been consistent. So, not only did this charger charge the battery, it also fixed whatever was preventing it from getting a full charge. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: The Professor

customer_reviews.title: It worked well
customer_reviews.text: Have an electrical leak somewhere in one of the cars and the battery would die overnight. The only honest mechanic in my area would not take the job because he was afraid to run the bill up high because the amount of labor and tests it would take would've been astronomical. The battery's kind of shot now (this smart charger would indicate the battery was stuck below 75% even after a full night's charge) but guess what? Not more dead car battery in the morning. Easy, painless and safe to install everyday.
customer_reviews.author: v4vendetta

customer_reviews.title: Performed as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I am someone who knows little to nothing about batteries. I however needef to charge my sealed lead 12 volt (brush mower), and chose this to do the job. I did spend longer than I would have liked googling to determine which of the 3, 12volt modes I should pick. I selected the maintenance free choice, but the battery seems common enough I wish an explanation for sealed lead acid battery had been listed in The documentation. I am learning tho, in the end this did everythi g it said it would do :) so the LED indicator made it clear. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Burns

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a second, might order a third
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to keep my car charged, since it's been rarely driven during the pandemic and has a low battery warning after a couple weeks. It was simple to setup and works great! I plugged it into the same outlet as the garage door lift--nothing to trip over. Except I also want to use it on a garden tractor--so I've ordered a second so each garage bay has a charger. And then I might order a third for the bench for the winter--maybe that's too much, but at the moment one isn't enough.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Yes it did take a long time but I got a Genius1. Took about 5 days to recharge a car battery in which was completely dead. However, the product was so easy to use, very convenient compared to going to a store to have them charge it (which I never ended up doing) and when I put it back in the battery seemed to work so much better than it previously did. I highly recommend it. For those antsy impatient types get the higher amp models to get a faster charge but this was perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bonesy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for RV battery
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep my RV deep cycle battery topped off while the rig is stored. This worked great! I was worried about it being too small or junky, not at all. Left my battery hooked up to this for the last month then took the battery out yesterday to use it. Fully charged! No more dead RV batteries for me
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt fully charge agm batteries
customer_reviews.text: After trying for three weeks the charger wouldn't reach 14.7 volts which is needed to fully charge AGM batteries. It id work on regular flooded cell starting batteries. So if that is all you need, it'll work. But if you need AGM charger look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: scoutmstr

customer_reviews.title: Charges AGM Batteries very well.
customer_reviews.text: Takes about a day and a half to charge an AGM Battery. It will, however, test the battery and alert if it’s no good.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but read about it's features before buying
customer_reviews.text: This manufacturer has a bunch of great products so just be sure you buy one that suits your needs. You will have to know some specifics about the type of battery you are using it on and maybe use an amp meter to determine if the battery charge is less than 2volts as the procedure for charging is different than if it is above 2volts. I bought this model mostly to keep my car battery alive while in storage but it also was able to revive it from a near zero charge.
customer_reviews.author: Chas E

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t have SAE connector
customer_reviews.text: Nice but doesn’t use the standard SAE 2 pin connector that all the other trickle chargers have, it has a custom connector. Why? That means I can’t use it with the other adapters I have. I don’t have outlets near where I use this, so I need to extend the cable. With other chargers I use the SAE extender instead of a regular outlet extension cable. Can’t do that with this connector. Now I have to cut those off and put standard connectors on it.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT but be ready to wait
customer_reviews.text: Super easy charger to use. But, being only a 1am charger it took 3 full days to charge a dead 12v car battery. But, it worked! Hook it to your battery, plug it into the wall, press the button for your battery type and you're set. Red Pulsing light lets you know it's charging. Green Pulsing light means it's optimizing and solid green means it's complete. Worth $23 dollars for sure if you're not in a hurry. If you need a faster charger then you have to move up to a 5 or 10 amp charger.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. CT

customer_reviews.title: Money grab on unnecessary accessories
customer_reviews.text: Instead of being like every other battery tender they decided to make their own special plug for the leads, and then sell an accessory that matches every other tender plug. Money grab from a company that already charges more for their product than just about anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Small, Strong and Working!
customer_reviews.text: Keep the manual!! If you want to know what the LED's indicate. Look up what your battery is!! I assumed my battery was a 6V because that's the charger my wife had been using forever, when it broke I bought this. Turns out, my battery is a 12V so it's always good to double check! Functions out of the box, everything hooked up correctly, LED's worked and indicates it is charging. I'll update to a 5 star if it actually charges the battery overnight~!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended!
customer_reviews.text: I have a viper alarm system for my car and it drained my new car battery during the lockdown. I ordered a duracell jumpstarter from costco and it only worked once and returned but this works better as it does not rely on jump starting. My battery was completely dead and this charged it back to full in a few days. It's good if you are not driving a lot (like during lockdown) and have something like an extra alarm system that drains your battery.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Item was received before the estimated delivery range. The product was easy to use. Charged up a 12V 7.5Ah SLA battery that was at 6v in about 6.5 hours. That was the estimated full charge, topped off time for my battery. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: PKC

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you are not time bound
customer_reviews.text: I got a dead battery on my Nissan Leaf. It is a painful thing since the charger stops working. There is no way to charge the car without first charging the battery. I saw good reviews on this product. This product is easy to assemble and use. The only thing you need to pay attention is that it will not be able to detect a completely dead battery. So, you have to activate the charge process. It takes more than 12 hours for me to charge the battery so that I can kick off my normal charging for my EV car.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work, but there's a potential flaw.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was originally intended to keep my motorcycle battery charged up during the winter; ;however, my initial use for this unit was to bring up a 12-V automotive battery up as it had discharged to ~60% capacity. I left it on for 12 hours and it did charge up the battery. My concern was the main controlling unit was very warm, but not hot, to the touch. Can't recall any of my previous similar chargers heated up like this one. We'll see how well it works as its intended use over t he winter. It'll be checked frequently as I don't want a meltdown of the charger or the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: To hard to use
customer_reviews.text: You have to scroll through a menu using a button to set it up. In the day light you cannot see the LED's. I'm at two try's and two weeks of trying to get it to work. It's at remote location I have to drive to. I'm ready to throw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Multiple Failure
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. First one died within 2 months. 4 months later both are dead. They were charging my truck, kept under the hood behind the grill while parked in my driveway. Absolute garbage product. Not up to the task of basic maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Serves the intended purpose well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the unit as a trickle/maintenance charger for our lawn tractor - it has well served the purpose, does not get hot even when left connected for over a week and maintains correct voltage. The unit performs very well as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph C. Hand Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on VW New Beetle & Prius
customer_reviews.text: This battery recharger is perfect for our cars that are only driven once or twice a month sitting in a garage. It charged a drained battery from 9.2V to 12V in a few days. For the VW New Beetle, it was straightforward to connect to the battery terminals. For the Prius, it took a little trial and error, but after connecting the negative to a metal bolt near the positive connector, it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: orbops

customer_reviews.title: CHARGE!
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best trickle charger I've ever owned. Has worked great for my motorcycle battery and I love the option to set a different voltage. This can't be any easier to use and the construction is good enough that I'm not going to be having any trouble with something just needlessly breaking because it's a cheap part. Hopefully it won't go kaput over time (remains to be seen). Love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Angus Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: my car batter was completely dead, and the alternator was gone so that the battery wasnt charging... i was able to use this to keep my car running while i was trying to find a new one. basically just charged the batter with this each night.. it did take pretty much what they said in the manual to fully charge battery (i think like 24-36 hours), but that is how they had presented it so worked as advertised..
customer_reviews.author: Hard to Please

customer_reviews.title: neet little charger
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I have 3 batteries in my boat and 2 in my trailer..... once a year i pull them all out and top them off with distilled water and give them a bench charge.... my old charger that i boutght in the 90's finally kicked the bucket so i bought this one....fantastic it charges and conditions. Its is compact and efficient.....im considering buying 4 more to do all my batteries at once!
customer_reviews.author: Todd Butler

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This works. It's been running a couple of months now. I'm not really charging with it, just maintaining a deep cycle battery that I charged elsewhere. Nice clips. Nice look. I'll see how it how it goes long term. I used battery tender Jr's over the years but they just don't last. I got 10 years out of my trolling battery but I'm on my 3rd battery tender. Hopefully this lasts awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Southplank

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy
customer_reviews.text: My 1st car battery charger I've ever bought. I tend to buy car batteries every 2 years. Sometimes during the change of weather my battery tends to lose its charge. Recently my battery died, I charged my car battery through the day and over night then It was able to start up again. Only draw back is that this model is for long slow charges. If you want a quicker charge get one with a higher Amp
customer_reviews.author: Bearbizzle

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 2 of these and they both have failed! Bought one for my son and found out his quit working now the one i got for myself has also fialeg in just one month!. No power no leds light at all worked good till now their warranty is that you have to return and they may or may not cover itthats a joke for an item that failed in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene

customer_reviews.title: Requires adapter for proprietary plug
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it works yet. Just opened the package and discovered it has a proprietary plug that requires another $8.59 adapter to plug into the pigtail on my motorcycle. Most battery maintainers use the standard SAE pigtail and have one included for less money. Somewhat annoyed I have to spend more money and wait more time to use a product that comes incomplete.
customer_reviews.author: sam-i-am

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 decade old Battery Tender finally died so I was looking for a replacement. It does kind of suck that the quick connect is proprietary but it makes sense I guess? I was going to make a YouTube video about this charger but there's not much to cover. This thing is simple and it just works!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great so far.  Seems to work fine
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint that I have is that the wiring is a little flimsy and may not stand the test of time. fortunately, I have my battery plugged in all the time (until I take the trailer out) and the charger stays put. Time will tell how it does at maintaining the battery. The SEARS/DieHard brand that I bought a handful of years ago didn't do such a good job.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Miracle Worker
customer_reviews.text: My car battery completely died after the first three months of the Great Covid Isolation of 2020. Ten minutes of trying a jump start and my wife wanted to get a tow, but I held out hope. I figured, although it was a longshot to recharge the battery, I'd have a trickle charger if I had to let the car sit again. The NOCO GENIUS1 performed a miracle. After two days it brought my battery back from the dead. Much cheaper than a new battery! (Disclaimer: no idea if my results are typical.)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Russon

customer_reviews.title: This didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried to revive a car battery that got discharged after 2 weeks of not being used. I plugged in the battery for 48 hours. It still blinked red after all that time. I either gotten a broken unit, or this thing is too genial for me.
customer_reviews.author: Silivestru

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable, good quality and meaningful instructions.
customer_reviews.text: I had NOCO G750 for many years and always worked well. I lost it somewhere and recd this new unit Which had many positive reviews. When I found the old unit, I decided to return it. The manufacturer has very useful instruction and the quality cables and clips are of quality compared to others. I believe this unit is very dependable similar to my old one.
customer_reviews.author: Ami Sidpara

customer_reviews.title: 1 amp noco charger maintainer
customer_reviews.text: I have several battery operated pieces of equipment as such need several battery maintainers. As batteries age, there is even more of a need to have a decent battery charger/maintainer on each piece of equipment. I purchased these on a sale, and have to say they are much better quality then other brands costing more. The clamps are extremely well made and having differant settings for standard, AGM, Lithium surly a benifit into the future.
customer_reviews.author: RWM189sr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the girl who knows nothing on electric gear.
customer_reviews.text: Lifesaver. I know SQUAT with recharging batteries and I don’t own a volt reader, yet I need a functioning fish finder. THANKFULLY I came across this suggested, safe charger after much fumbling around on Google (why this doesn’t come up as a suggested product under the battery’s Amazon page is way beyond me). So glad & grateful.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: It's alive!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical, at first, that it would not work. but after a couple YouTube and 8 hours later, my lawn tractor was up and running again. Was not expecting something so small for a battery charger. The directions provided are not overly detailed so I had to resort to YouTube. i would recommend this and will look at this fall to use as the trickle charging feature.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Wolman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing device if you are in no hurry.
customer_reviews.text: Two things. A) It's 1A expect days to get a badly discharged battery to full capacity. B) You have to select the battery type if you have something other than very standard 12V lead acid. If you are in no hurry you can't beat this for the money. Easy to use. Brought back the battery that was basically left for dead by the standard charger.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R.

customer_reviews.title: Trust NoCo
customer_reviews.text: Like every NoCo item I’ve purchased I was impressed with not only the charger, but how well it was packaged. The charger itself is simple to operate and surprisingly better quality than their previous units. Great value for the price too.
customer_reviews.author: Jef

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, easy to set up and use. Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: My vehicle died because I haven't been driving it during the pandemic, and it sat dead for about 3 months. This charger worked perfectly to get the battery charged back up (took 2 days, I think), and I keep it plugged in at all times now. Very easy to set up and use, no issues at all. Would buy again. (vehicle is a 2006 GMC Envoy Denali)
customer_reviews.author: Cas

customer_reviews.title: Reviving gold cart batteries
customer_reviews.text: I have a golf cart with 6 6v batteries that would not charge with the regular cart charger. I got this and I'm able to charge two batteries at the time (2 6v batteries in series act like a 12v battery). The batteries started with about 1.2v and wen to 6.2v. And this charger is small! really easy to carry around if you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Medina

customer_reviews.title: Good maintenance charger
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to hook up to my tractor and truck which often don't get driven for a week or more. I like the visual display. It appears to boost the voltage up to 13.7 volts during cold weather, which seems high, but I don't know. So far they have done a good job maintaining the batteries; I'm hoping it means I will buy less batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Alan C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 for boat starting, boat trolling motor, and car start batteries I maintain when not in use. Cycles through and settles in to maintenace/monitoring mode and restarts charing when needed - as expected. Confirmed maintenance voltage is 12.83v which is safe for long term. Much better than budgeet HF units I was using that maintained voltage too high at ~14v and I believe probably did long term damage at that higher, consistent voltage.
customer_reviews.author: Wundbar

customer_reviews.title: Small product - Big job
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 30 year old Western Auto battery charger with this product. It is amazing how technology has improved in the last thirty years. This product is compact, efficient and reliable. I have it connected to a 2002 Tacoma that is in storage and it is doing a fantastic job. I highly recommend this charger/tender.
customer_reviews.author: William Bailey

customer_reviews.title: It takes more than 3 days to fully charge a car battery
customer_reviews.text: This is only 1-Amp current. So it takes forever to charge a car battery. If you can't wait three days then buy a one with higher current. 2-Amp or 5-Amp versions should do it faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jack London

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this product even works
customer_reviews.text: I refrained from 1 star because it's possible there is another issue, but this has been unable to charge my golf cart batteries. It's been hooked up for weeks now, and there has been no sign of any power to the batteries. This golf cart is less than a year old, so I can't imagine the batteries were shot that quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: parts missing
customer_reviews.text: According to box it was suppose to have a ring connector along with the alligator clips.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Srader

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: My father has a car that only gets driven every few weeks, and rarely for much more than local trips. Got tired of getting calls to go to his house to jump start it. This was able to charge the nearly dead battery sufficiently to get the car started, and has been keeping it charged up since. Simple enough for anyone to use and the lights provide good feedback from across the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Paul F

customer_reviews.title: Simple Charger
customer_reviews.text: Seems to charge a battery. Like the idea of the force mode as a really dead battery can't be charged on these new "too-smart" chargers. I'm glad someone has recognized that flaw and created a way around it. Only thing I don't like is the proprietary clip ends meaning I can't use the standard battery bolt on leads.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Keeps rarely used car battery charged
customer_reviews.text: Not driving during the COVID-19 pandemic caused my car battery in my Honda Civic to drain to a point where it would not start my car. This gadget charged the battery up and is now maintaining the batteries charge. Really easy to use. Works perfectly. Battery was reading 3V before attaching and the NOCO Genious 1 charged it up to 13.1V. Took about 2 days for bulk charge and then 2 more in the conditioning phase.
customer_reviews.author: hobbyist

customer_reviews.title: 1 and Done
customer_reviews.text: After my 20 year charger died. I looked hard for a replacement and found NOCO. By far it offers me the convenice in a small package and the programming it offers. I can charge any 12v type battery including 6v. I don't need speed so I stuck with 1 amp. Great for my needs as I come across 12v batteries all the time, as I pick them up, charge them up and stick them in my solar power battery bank.
customer_reviews.author: WILL

customer_reviews.title: Must have with the Covid Lockdowns to recharge auto batteries
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. Nice little handy dandy charger to keep the juices flowing in your batteries. Packaged well and with good instructions. Overall, we love this little charger.
customer_reviews.author: shakeum

customer_reviews.title: Great little charger for the price
customer_reviews.text: I left the headlights on my car on overnight and didn't try to start it again until a couple days later(stupid, I know). It was too dead for my jumper box and I ordered this product out of desperation even though I know some chargers can't recognize a battery once it's too low. When it got here a few days later, my battery had been dead over a week. It only took me a few minutes to figure out how to operate it and a few hours later, the ole car fired right up. I doubt you'll find a more reliable charger for the price range.
customer_reviews.author: Robynn A.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a battery charger/maintainer for my Polaris atv. I have used other NoCo products and they are impressive. So, I ordered this guy and the SAE adapter to plug directly into the factory atv wiring plug. Plugged right in, plenty of cable length, and very simple to set and get going. Very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works great, get it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I literally saved $200 with this charger. My car battery was dead because I wasnt driving as much due to covid. I was able revive it with this charger.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Martinez

customer_reviews.title: works well, on the right batteries
customer_reviews.text: the charger itself works really well, and i would recommend it. however, i gave it 4 stars because it can't charge smaller capacity GEL cells. i tried to charge a 12V 7ah battery, and it wouldn't work. i also tried to charge a 12V 9ah battery, and that wouldn't work either. both batteries were from UPS units, and they charge just fine in the UPS units themselves.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sroelov

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Charger
customer_reviews.text: As the owner of a Jeep Wrangler 3.6L JL, I have had my share of issues with the vehicle's auxiliary battery, which operates its ESS (electronic stop start system). Jeepsters will know what I am talking about. Anyway, I am happy to report that the Nogo Genius 1 works as advertised. It is very easy to connect and operate, and my secondary battery is now always full of juice. This is a 1 amp charger, however, so a depleted battery may take quite a while to fully charge, up to a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: R. Tempest

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Charged 3 batteries within a day that were not dead as I just wanted to test the charger on some stored batteries. Used the first setting Maintenance free acid/lead sealed that were at first all red indicator then an hour or less it goes to Green pulse showing trickle ..... Not sure the other settings
customer_reviews.author: c banks

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my standby generator’s battery charged.
customer_reviews.text: There’s lots of smarts built in to this little gadget. Most important, it never OVER-charges a battery, which means you can leave it on 24Seven365.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Campbell

feature_bullets: Meet the GENIUS1 - Similar to our G750, just better. It's 35% smaller and delivers 35% more power. It's the all-in-one solution - battery charger, battery maintainer, trickle charger, plus battery desulfator.
Do more with Genius - Designed for 6-volt and 12-volt lead-acid automotive, marine, and deep-cycle batteries, including flooded, gel, AGM, and maintenance-free, plus lithium-ion batteries.
Enjoy precision charging - An integrated thermal sensor detects the ambient temperature and alters the charge to eliminate over-charging in hot climates and under-charging in cold climates.
Charge dead batteries - Charges batteries as low as 1-volt. Or use the all-new force mode that allows you to take control and manually begin charging dead batteries down to zero volts.
Restore your battery - Automatically detects battery sulfation and acid stratification to restore lost battery performance for stronger engine starts and extended battery life.
Beyond maintenance - It's not just a trickle charger, it's an advanced battery maintainer. A fully-automatic, worry-free battery charger for everyday use - 24/7 - with zero overcharge.
Compatible with all types of vehicles - charge and maintain cars, motorcycles, lawnmowers, ATVs, lawn tractors, trucks, SUVs, boats, PWCs, classic cars, and more.
